ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic otitis media
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of lifelong infections, bilateral mastoidectomies, constant drainage, and mixed hearing loss with significant air-bone gaps.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cholesteatoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Strong pungent odor and constant drainage suggest the possibility of cholesteatomas.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and tympanic membrane integrity.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc and check for retrocochlear pathology.
To differentiate between conductive and retrocochlear pathology given the mixed loss.
To assess outer hair cell function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results indicate a bilateral mixed hearing loss, predominantly conductive, with significant air-bone gaps. Speech recognition is excellent. Immittance testing failed to obtain a seal, consistent with perforations or open mastoid cavities. ABR and tone decay results rule out retrocochlear pathology and support a conductive etiology.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral mixed hearing loss. AC thresholds flat ~40-50 dB HL. BC thresholds 0-10 dB HL in low/mid frequencies, dropping to 30-40 dB HL at 4000 Hz. Significant air-bone gaps.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT (Right: 45 dB HL, Left: 40 dB HL) aligns with pure-tone averages. SRS is excellent (Right: 92%, Left: 94%).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: No seal obtainable in either ear, consistent with patent perforations or open mastoid cavities.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: All waves prolonged absolute latencies; interpeak latencies and latency-intensity functions normal. Consistent with conductive hearing loss.

tests.name: Tone decay test
tests.result_summary: Negative for retrocochlear pathology at 4000 Hz (0 dB decay Right, 5 dB decay Left).

proposed_items: Obtain written medical clearance before proceeding with hearing aid evaluation.
Consider bone-conduction hearing aids if ear drainage is a persistent problem preventing air-conduction aid use.
Consider conventional hearing aids if medical treatment resolves drainage and clearance is obtained.
Arrange for periodic monitoring of hearing loss.
counseling_actions: Discuss the mixed nature of the hearing loss and its relationship to the history of infections.
Explain that while hearing can be improved, the sensorineural component means it cannot be made completely normal.
Use diplomacy when referring to the specialist to avoid criticizing the family doctor's previous advice.
Keep the patient informed of progress and implications of the diagnosis.

red_flags_present: History of mastoidectomies with current symptoms

escalation.rationale_short: Strong odor and drainage suggest active infection or cholesteatoma requiring specialist management; second opinion needed as family doctor indicated no options.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing loss and middle ear status; follow up on medical management outcomes.
